Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at the events for Case A1 and B2, I can see that each case starts with retrieving a raw metal sheet, scanning the barcode, placing it on a table, aligning, and preheating. These actions all seem to be part of preparing the material before any assembly happens.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Next, after preheating, theres picking up a welding tool followed by welding corners A and B. Then measuring the weld integrity. These actions involve assembling parts together and checking the quality of that assembly.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Then theres applying a protective coating, drying it with another heating unit, and finally a visual check by an operator. The coating application and drying seem like finishing steps to protect the product. The visual check at the end is another quality check but done manually. So perhaps these are part of a Coating and Finishing step followed by a final Quality Assurance step.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: But in the sample data, both cases have Measure weld integrity right after welding. This might be an inline quality check during assembly rather than a separate inspection phase. So grouping that with welding makes sense as part of Assembly.

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: Wait but in the sample log for A1: After welding corners A and B done by Operator B, then Measure weld integrity Quality Sensor 1 occurs at 08:01:20, then apply coating at 08:01:30. So maybe Measure weld integrity is part of Assembly as an inline check before moving to the next step? Or is it part of a separate Quality Inspection phase?

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Resources involved in each step. Material Preparation involves Operator A retrieving and placing the sheet, Robot Arm aligning, Heating Unit preheating. Assembly involves Operator B using a welding tool. Quality checks use Quality Sensor 1 and later Operator C for visual. Coating involves Coating Unit 3 and Heating Unit 2 for drying.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Group based on temporal proximity and logical sequence. In terms of time stamps: For Case A1: Material Prep events from 08:00:05 to 08:00:20 15 seconds. Then gap until 08:01:00 when Assembly starts 40 seconds later. Assembly from 08:01 to 08:01:10 10 seconds. Post-Assembly QC at 08:01:20 10 sec later.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: The time gaps between groups may support these groupings as each group has events clustered closely followed by a short gap before next group starts. Therefore this structure seems reasonable.
